interconnection.net_metering_details: Alaska has voluntary net metering programs offered by several utilities. System size limits vary by utility, typically up to 25 kW for residential.

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: No solar access law. HOAs may restrict solar installations.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Historic district review may apply in Juneau, Anchorage, and other municipalities with preservation ordinances.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: High wind zones in coastal and island areas require enhanced wind load design per ASCE 7.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Significant snow load requirements throughout the state; ground snow loads range from 40-300+ psf depending on location. Structural engineering review typically required.

licensing.license_type: Electrical Contractor or Electrician registered with Dept of Community & Economic Development; requires 8,000 hours experience

notes: Alaska's extreme climate creates unique challenges for solar installations. Very long summer days provide excellent generation potential June-August, but minimal winter sunlight. Snow load requirements are among the highest in the nation. Limited solar market means fewer experienced installers. Permitting is handled locally with significant variation between boroughs and municipalities.
